input.description: adapter name [Optional] The name of the adapter that is enabled on the Peer. The default adapter name is IBMTSMActor

CREATE ASSOCIATION:
This wrapper associates one or more clients with a schedule. You must assign a client node to the policy domain to which a schedule belongs. Client nodes process operations according to the schedules associated with the nodes.
Sample Item Xml:
<items> <item> <operation-name>create-association</operation-name> <timeout-secs>30</timeout-secs> <command-options> <domain-name>standard</domain-name> <schedule-name>schedule00001</schedule-name> <nodes-name>shyam,vikasm</nodes-name> </command-options> </item> </items>
Elementsâ€™ Description:
operation-name [Required]: the operation name. Valid values: create-association.
timeout-secs [optional]: the time out second. the unit of this parameter is "second". Valid value: any integer greater than 0; Default value: 60.
command-options [Required]: within this element we provide the informations (elements) such as <domain-name>, <schedule-name>, <options> etc.
domain-name [Required]: Specifies the name of the policy domain to which the schedule belongs. Valid values: The domain-name whom the targeted schedule belongs to.
schedule-name [Required]: Specifies the name of the schedule that you want to associate with one or more clients. Valid values: The targeted schedule name.
nodes-name [Required]: Specifies the name of a client node or a list of client nodes to associate with the specified schedule. Use commas to separate the items in the list. Do not leave spaces between the items and commas. The command will not associate a listed client to the schedule if: - The client is already associated with the specified schedule. - The client is not assigned to the policy domain to which the schedule belongs. - The client is a NAS node name. All NAS nodes are ignored.
Valid values: The targeted node/nodes, wildcard character.

documentation.description: This wrapper associates one or more clients with a schedule. You must assign a client node to the policy domain to which a schedule belongs. Client nodes process operations according to the schedules associated with the nodes.
